Linguistic analysis: The expert may have analyzed the language used in the claim to determine if it matches the typical speech patterns of Trump or if there are any inconsistencies that suggest it may not be authentic.
Contextual analysis: The expert may have examined the context in which the claim was made to verify if it aligns with known events or statements made by Trump. This could involve checking the timeline of Trump's interactions with governors or any public statements he has made regarding their contact.
Source verification: The expert may have investigated the source of the claim to determine its credibility. This could involve checking the reputation and reliability of the individual or organization that made the claim, as well as cross-referencing it with other reputable sources.
Fact: checking: The expert may have conducted fact-checking to verify the accuracy of the claim. This could involve gathering additional evidence or data to support or refute the claim, such as contacting governors or reviewing official records of their communications with Trump.
